intro: Phyllanthus gneissicus var. gneissicus, commonly known as the Gneissic Phyllanthus, is a rare and unique plant species native to specific regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive leaf morphology, featuring thick, waxy leaves with a serrated margin. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, often blooming during the warmer months. Its growth is adapted to rocky, well-drained soils, reflecting its association with gneiss rock formations. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
